Generation III.Ruby: Seedot attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this Pok é mon 's body becomes.
Generation III.Sapphire: Seedot looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other Pok é mon by suddenly moving. This Pok é mon polishes its body once a day using leaves.
Generation III.Emerald: It hangs off branches and absorbs nutrients. When it finishes eating, its body becomes so heavy that it drops to the ground with a thump.
Generation III.FireRed: If it remains still, it becomes impossible to distinguish from real nuts. It delights in surprising foraging Pidgey .
Generation III.LeafGreen: If it remains still, it becomes impossible to distinguish from real nuts. It delights in surprising foraging Pidgey .

Generation IV.Diamond: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
Generation IV.Pearl: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
Generation IV.Platinum: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

Generation VI.X: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
Generation VI.Y: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Seedot attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this Pokémon's body becomes.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Seedot looks exactly like an acorn when it is dangling from a tree branch. It startles other Pokémon by suddenly moving. This Pokémon polishes its body once a day using leaves.

Generation VIII.Sword: If it remains still, it looks just like a real nut. It delights in surprising foraging Pokémon.
Generation VIII.Shield: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon that try to peck at it.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon that try to peck at it.

Generation IX.Scarlet: To expand its habitat, it pretends to be a nut so that bird Pokémon will pick it up and carry it far away.
Generation IX.Violet: Seedot live in trees, hanging from the branches and leeching moisture. Rows of them can be found dangling from large, young trees.
